page.title: 10 THE WOOLPACK PUBLIC HOUSE
page.content: In a rural area, leisure activities and places for the community to meet are restricted. One important building therefore is the Public House. This one situated in the village of Weston. These houses serve alcholic drinks to people aged 18 and over. Such drinks include beers (mild and bitter); wines; spirits (whisky;rum) and soft drinks (fruit juices,lemonade) However,in recent times,the nature of these places has had to change as increased taxation of alcholic drinks and harsher penalties for drinking and driving offences have induced a decline in their popularity. Meeting this challange the Woolpack now lays on lunch and evening meals which range from sandwiches to sausage and chips or Scampi and chips.There is also a beer garden.
